abstract: Oracle’s profit rose 36 percent in the fourth quarter, but poor hardware sales raised questions about the company’s ability to absorb Sun Microsystems.
snippet: Oracle’s profit rose 36 percent in the fourth quarter, but poor hardware sales raised questions about the company’s ability to absorb Sun Microsystems.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Oracle, long a shining star in the technology sector, posted disappointing results in its hardware segment on Thursday, leaving investors nervous about its ability to digest its acquisition of Sun Microsystems.

headline.main: Oracle’s Profit Rises, but Weak Hardware Sales Are Worrisome
headline.print_headline: Oracle’s Profit Rises, but Weak Hardware Sales Are Worrisome

abstract: A better-than-expected report on durable goods orders in May was offset by concerns over the health of some big Italian banks.
snippet: A better-than-expected report on durable goods orders in May was offset by concerns over the health of some big Italian banks.
lead_paragraph: Stocks retreated on Friday, sending the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index lower for a third consecutive day, as concern about the European debt crisis intensified and Oracle dragged down technology shares.

headline.main: European Worries Send U.S. Stocks Lower
headline.print_headline: Equities Skid Again on European Debt Fears

abstract: Oracle, one of the most aggressive buyers in the technology sector, with more than 70 deals since 2005, calls a time-out – for now.
snippet: Oracle, one of the most aggressive buyers in the technology sector, with more than 70 deals since 2005, calls a time-out – for now.
lead_paragraph: Tony Avelar/Bloomberg News Lawrence J. Ellison, Oracle’s chief executive, speaking last year in Santa Clara, Calif.

headline.main: Larry Ellison Calls Assets Overpriced, Curbs Deal-Making
